ref_item.label: Low speed of rewarming
ref_item.description: Patients will be placed in targeted temperature controlled at 33°C for 24 hours. Then, intervention will be proceeded after randomization: slowly rewarmed (0.25°C/h) to targeted temperature controlled at 37°C for 24 hours.

pred_item.label: 0.25 °C/h rewarming rate
pred_item.description: Patients with coma after shockable out-of-hospital cardiac arrest treated with targeted temperature management at 33 °C using a closed-loop surface cooling device. After approximately 24 h maintenance at 33 °C, rewarming was actively performed at a programmed rate of 0.25 °C per hour up to 37 °C, followed by active maintenance at 37 °C for 24 h. Sedation with midazolam and sufentanil, and shivering control including neuromuscular blockade, were protocolized and identical to the control arm.

ref_item.label: Fast speed of rewarming
ref_item.description: Patients will be placed in targeted temperature controlled at 33°C for 24 hours. hen, intervention will be proceeded after randomization: fastly rewarmed (0.50°C/h) for targeted temperature controlled at 37°C for 24 hours.

pred_item.label: 0.50 °C/h rewarming rate
pred_item.description: Patients with coma after shockable out-of-hospital cardiac arrest treated with targeted temperature management at 33 °C using a closed-loop surface cooling device. After approximately 24 h maintenance at 33 °C, rewarming was actively performed at a programmed rate of 0.50 °C per hour up to 37 °C, followed by active maintenance at 37 °C for 24 h. Sedation with midazolam and sufentanil, and shivering control including neuromuscular blockade, were protocolized and identical to the experimental arm.

ref_item.name: Low Speed of Rewarming
ref_item.description: Speed of rewarming will be at 0.25°C/h with specific temperature controlled external device

pred_item.name: Targeted temperature management with 0.25 °C/h rewarming
pred_item.description: Targeted temperature management protocol for comatose patients after shockable out-of-hospital cardiac arrest: induction and rapid achievement of a core body temperature of 33 °C using a closed-loop surface cooling device (Artic Sun), maintenance at 33 °C for 24 h, then active rewarming at a programmed rate of 0.25 °C per hour until 37 °C is reached, followed by active maintenance at 37 °C for 24 h.

ref_item.name: High Speed of Rewarming
ref_item.description: Speed of rewarming will be at 0.50°C/h with specific temperature controlled external device

pred_item.name: Targeted temperature management with 0.50 °C/h rewarming
pred_item.description: Targeted temperature management protocol for comatose patients after shockable out-of-hospital cardiac arrest: induction and rapid achievement of a core body temperature of 33 °C using a closed-loop surface cooling device (Artic Sun), maintenance at 33 °C for 24 h, then active rewarming at a programmed rate of 0.50 °C per hour until 37 °C is reached, followed by active maintenance at 37 °C for 24 h.

ref_item.measure: Changes in Serum Il6 Levels Over the 48 Hours Following Achievement of the Thermal Target
ref_item.description: Median AUC for serum IL6 levels over time

pred_item.description: Systemic inflammation assessed by the area under the curve (AUC) of serum IL6 levels, considering only IL6 values measured after randomization during the rewarming phase.
pred_item.timeFrame: Between 24 and 48 hours after reaching the target temperature of 33 °C
